column1: swing. Yes, swing. Squares him up by having this jag away off the deck from length outside off, beaten. Wow
back of length outside off again, defended to point
draws him forward with the length. Full, just a hint of movement in the air as Dickwella gets forward and defends with soft hands
shortens his length this time, angles one back in from wide of the crease, Dickwella firmly behind the line in defence
gorgeous! Half-volley outside off, he leans into the drive and just eases this between cover and point. Transferred his weight forward as he timed it beautifully.
length on middle and leg, tucked to the leg side
squeezed to cover point. Full on off, swerved away late, Gunathilaka was looking to play onside initially
peach. Hint of movement from off stump, leaves him late to beat Gunathilaka's feeble forward push
back of length on off stump, bunted back to the bowler
another cracker of a delivery! Excellent seam position, nips away off the deck as Gunathilaka is beaten in trying to punch that on the up
solidly behind the line of the good length delivery, pushed back down the pitch
looks to smack this on the up over the bowler's head, played too early. Could only connect with the cold air.
uppish but just short of Hafeez at midwicket. Length on middle and leg, timed the flick well though
firm push into the gap, lovely timing. Not entirely forward but does well to lean into the stroke and play it with the swing
defends the away-going delivery to point this time
clears the infield. This one lobbed high but eluded square leg. Dickwella was trying to flick this over midwicket, didn't middle it at all, top-edged it
in the driving channel, just outside off, Gunathilaka is happy to leave

authoritative flick! Lovely balance, super timing. Excellent work by debutant Faheem Ashraf too. This was sliding into the pads and he picked it away off the middle. Long square boundaries meant the fielder had enough time if he hared across. Good cricket
width and thumped into the cover boundary. Picked the length early, transferred the weight back and crashed that away
gets forward and shows the full face of the bat as he defends the length ball on off stump

drifts this into middle and off, Gunathilaka looks to loft over mid-on but ends up dragging it over midwicket. Not timed well,  but there's enough for it to trickle over the ropes. What's good to see is the intent
hops back and bunts the short of length delivery to the off side
nurdles a length ball to the leg side as they scamper a quick single

wow, Dilshan would be proud of that. Gave away his intent even before the bowler delivered. Walked across the stumps and scoops the length ball on middle over the keeper's head. Nearly carried all the way
dishes in a short ball on middle and leg, whizzes past his helmet as he looks to duck. Good decision by Bruce Oxenford
touch ahead of length on off, defended with soft hands
hit hard on the up but straight to mid-off
shows the full face of the bat in defence again to play it back to the bowler
good length again. Hits the deck hard at length on off. Gunathilaka gets onto his toes and bunts it to cover
sliding into the pads, turned into the gap between midwicket and mid-on. Easy two missed. Lazy running

chipped straight to Malik at mid-off. Looked to hit on the up but this wasn't there, he went through irrespective. No timing whatsoever. Boost for Pakistan just as Gunathilaka was starting to look dangerous
this one nips away off the deck from length on middle, he hops back and across to defend with soft hands
plays back to a delivery he could've been well forward, defended from the crease in the end
nips away again, he looks to turn it wide of midwicket, rolls off the outer half of the bat to cover
invites the drive by floating this full and across Mendis, who lets it go
another leave. Much fuller and across Mendis, who is happy to watch this through to the keeper. Zip off the deck for Junaid
slower length ball on off stump, bunted to the off side
chops an attempted cut to slip. Not much room to play the stroke even though the length was on the shorter side
whipped wide of midwicket. Hit really well but an excellent chase from Ashraf to pull it back
thick outside edge down to third man. Once again pushing at an away-going delivery from the crease
angles a short ball into the body at 139kph, Dickwella ducks under it
angling into the pads, lovely wrist work to put that away into the gap at midwicket

shot of the morning! The kind you'd pay to watch. Not overpitched but Mendis leans forward, shows the full face of the bat and meets it with a nice high elbow to play that straight drive back past the bowler. Classy
works the length ball on middle to midwicket
right back into the crease as he punches the length ball to point
short-arm jab but can't time it. Straight to midwicket. The short ball hurried onto him
wristy whip wide of mid-on, quick single taken
pulled but straight to Imad at square leg. Intent right, controlled it well too. Just that he hit it straight to the man at the edge of the ring
drifts one into middle and leg, turned to midwicket
turned to short fine leg. Skidding through again. Off the inside edge this time
full on the pads, flicked to deep square leg
length on off, punched to point
tossed up outside off, not much turn as he eases that wide of cover, quick single taken
sliding into the pads, nudled to the man coming in from deep square. Sensible from Kusal
short of length on his hips, he hops across and whips it from middle past square leg. Lovely weight transfer, superb wrist work to generate the power.

driven back to Junaid, who fires a throw back at the batsman. Mendis had to back away quickly but the ball kept following him. Somehow managed to avoid the wayward throw. Enough to make Mendis angry? No, he smiles.
what a reply! Digs in a short ball on middle, Mendis picks the length early and pulls him imperiously into the square leg boundary
back of a length, angled in at off stump this time. He gets on his toes and shovels this to deep square
offcutter, tossed up wide outside off stump, driven off the toe-end to extra cover
another short ball, this one's way over the batsman's head. Rightly called wide
appeal for lbw, but it wasn't the sound of wood. This one cut back in from outside off, looked to whip it off his hip but was beaten as the ball deflected to the keeper off the back thigh guard.
in-drifter on middle and leg, turned wide of square leg
gets outside the line of the stumps and paddles it down to fine leg. Excellent running
steps out and drives the full delivery back to the bowler
delicate little dab. Short and angling away, he stays inside the crease, opens the bat face late to steer this past short third man. Lovely
this time, he's steered that to the left of short third man. Deep point comes around to cut that off
straighter one angling across, nurdled into the gap at midwicket for a cheeky single
angles a yorker-length delivery on off stump, squeezed down to square third man. Neatly done
floated full on the pads, flicked into the gap at deep backward square leg. Nervous start this from Ashraf
this one's much better. Floated across at length, not much room to drive, Dickwella gets a thick inside-edge back to the bowler
nearly dragged it back onto the stumps. Looks to bunt this behind square but got an inside edge, luckily covered the bounce with his pad
whipped away into the vacant spaces at deep midwicket. Superb running, Babar Azam caught napping Second time they've got two after hitting it towards him
crunching drive but a super stop by Hafeez at extra cover. Saved a certain boundary
welcomed with a beautiful drive on the up. Touch too full, Mendis leans into the drive and hammers that wide of cover. Ah, so beautiful. Warm-up delivery from Hasan
whipped across the line to square leg
width outside off, eased to square third man
skiddy short of length delivery on off stump, he pats it gently to the man coming in from point as they scamper a quick single
knuckleball this time at length, gets some lift off the deck, Dickwella gets on top of the bounce and turns it wide of square leg
beauty! Steep bounce again from length on off, Mendis played inside the line as he saw the ball whizz past the outside edge
full and angling across the left-hander, who guides it to backward point
whipped to wide mid-on, looked up and hared across as his partner responded to the call. Sensible cricket this
Aravinda de Silva touch on that flick. All wrist work as he plays that from middle, towards deep midwicket. What balance. So, so impressive
skiddy length ball angling into middle and leg, worked off his hip to deep midwicket
risky, but he's timed it superbly. Makes room, exposes all three stumps and then glides the length ball on middle to square third man
short ball on middle, he's right back onto his toes as he gets on top of the bounce and bunts it to the off side for a quick single
length ball that nips away from off stump, bunted back down the pitch
length on middle and leg, uses the pace to whip this into the fine leg region
back of length and just around the off stump, Mendis anticipated this to nip away and lets this go. Went straight on though
nearly sneaked through. Saved by an inside-edge. Looked to flick this from middle, got a fat inside-edge onto the pad.

through his defence. Special ball. Mendis was looking threatening and it has taken a special delivery to send him back. Angles a length ball on middle from wide of the crease, Mendis is looking to whip this leg side but the ball jags away late to beat the bat and hit top of off. He lets out a roar. Big wicket
beauty! Jags back in sharply to hit him on the box. Deflects past the cordon. Played outside the line of the length ball. Top stuff

dragged on! Maiden ODI wicket for Ashraf. Full outside off, no feet movement whatsoever as he looks to slap that through cover. Went hard at it, could only find a thick inside edge back onto the stumps. How the game has turned.
hops back and across to defend that length ball
went for a booming drive, another inside edge this time, onto the pad. Was on the move as he tried to belt that
floats it full and outside off, gets this to nip away off the seam, Mathews leaves
width outside off, slapped away to deep point to get off the mark
pulled away, but did well to keep it all along the ground. Down to deep backward square leg
short ball on leg stump, Dickwella swivels back and helps the pull to deep square
gets outside the line of the incoming length ball and turns it to the leg side
beauty of a delivery. This one nips away late to square Mathews up. Nibbling away on off stump.
kept a touch low this time, Mathews looks to punch it through point but this one rolled off the toe-end of the bat
leans forward and eases a full ball to extra cover
full and straight on off, gets this to tail back in late, squeezed to cover
short of length on middle and leg, this jumped on him, but Dickwella did well to roll his wrists over the delivery to nurdle it to the man coming in from deep square. Superb running
played outside the line of the skiddy length ball on off. Shaved past the inside edge.
ill-directed, length and way down leg. Easy call for Erasmus. Any sort of bat on it and it could've beaten the keeper and fine leg for four
this is angled far too wide outside off, well outside the wide line. Dickwella doesn't bother playing at that, as he should
backs away and thumps the short of length delivery straight to point
eased to the left of point as they scamper a quick single
hops back and turns the incoming length ball towards midwicket as he scampers a quick single
too full outside off, he waits inside the crease and squeezes this wide of point, to square third man
bangs this one in, back of a length. He's quickly on his toes to nudge this to fine leg
back of a length, angled in at off stump, walks across and takes this off his hips to deep square
good length, angled across off stump, tapped back to the bowler on the up with a closed face
good length, angling in at off stump. Batsman puts in a nice stride and pushes this wide of mid-on
back of a length outside off stump, straightens after pitching, left alone
slash and miss. This is a tad short, but well wide. Not too much feet from Mathews, so he doesn't get close enough to connect on the cut
gives him the charge, beaten for length, cops this on the pad as he looks to flick a leg side ball
this is full, and he waits for it. Tucks it off his toes to short fine and brings up his fifty
edged and safe. A bit loose from Mathews the last few minutes. Feeble poke at this good length ball, and it's a straight one. But there's no slip
good length, off stump, solidly behind this one and defended with soft hands
leading edge this time against a length ball as he tries to flick, short third man in business
steps down the track, beaten by length again, cops it on the pad again
gets forward and defends the cross-seam delivery to the off side
hops back and tucks the incoming length ball to the leg side
back of length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
Junaid nearly over-ran the ball at third man. Short ball angling into the stumps, Dickwella arched back to ramp this towards the boundary rider. Cheeky
back of length outside off, left alone. No movement off the deck that time
right besides the line of the ball as he defends from the crease
slider on middle and leg, whipped to midwicket where a sliding Malik cuts off the single. Top work
top-edges a sweep, but just short of deep square leg. Nowhere under the flight to play the slog. Kept spinning away from the fielder too
gets across the stumps and defends the indrifter to the on side
wrong line, drifts this down leg. Left alone by Mathews
another one on leg, Mathews misses a tickle, keeper fumbles and the ball deflects to short fine leg. Good call from the umpire, Mathews walked across the stumps that time
gets to the pitch of the ball and eases it down to long-on
flatter one on off stump, worked to midwicket
first warming for a beamer. Head-high full toss straight towards Dickwella's helmet, he did well to whip that one into the deep square leg region. Kept his eyes on the ball till the last moment.
that's where he's hit this, but has bisected the gap between deep square and deep midwicket. Low full toss and middle and he flicked that away superb;y
punched to sweeper cover as they jog the single
gets this to skid back in from length outside off, Dickwella gets onto his toes and bunts this down to third man
flicked into the deep square leg region
makes room and helps the short of length delivery on middle towards square third man. Played it really late to ease it to the left of point. Superb running too
whips it from outside off to deep square leg
ball obs off the top edge to his helmet. Got outside the line to play it
gets outside the line of the stumps and turns it to the leg side
nicely tossed up on off, this dips on him, he's half-forward in defence
picks the length early, rocks back and pulls the short ball into the gap at deep midwicket
misfield at point gives Dickwella a single. Cut that well
tossed up on middle and leg, works it wide of midwicket as they scamper a quick single
worked that from middle towards deep midwicket with soft hands, once again the boundary rider is late to get to the ball
mistimes a cut to cover. Too short but kept a touch low to hit the toe-end of the bat
fetches the flick from off stump to deep midwicket
touch wide outside off, on the shorter side as well, steered behind point
tossed up this time, rarity from Imad, Mathews is well forward as he blocks
the bowler runs to his left, short cover comes to his right, both of them miss it, as they squeeze a run
uses his feet to get to the pitch of the ball and deposits this over the long-on boundary. Not the longest boundary there, but it didn't matter even if it was. Top shot from Mathews

saved by the dive in the end. Walked outside the line of the stumps to nurdle this to the leg side, Imad does well to rush in quickly and fires a rocket throw at the bowler's end from mdiwicket. May have been short had he hobbled, but Mathews threw himself full-stretch.
looks to tickle it fine, gets some pad to short fine
whipped straight to square leg
on the flatter side, punched to deep square
hit on the pad as he looks to work across the line but got himself outside the line of the stumps as he stepped out
short and wide outside off, he crunches the cut straight to point. Opportunity missed. Mathews grimaces
full ball drifting into middle and leg, turned to the onside
touch short outside off, stays back in the crease and steers this wide of point
gets forward and eases the full ball back to Imad
very, very close. Straighter and faster on middle, Dickwella plays this really, really late to short third man. Looked to manufacture room but was cramped.
drifting into the pads, worked wide of square leg
makes room and forces one through cover
whipped to deep backward square leg. Too short
makes room and punches the short ball straight to Babar at cover
pulled and pulled well. Fakhar Zaman covers plenty of ground from deep square, ran nearly 25 yards to his right and then dished in a full-stretch dive to pull it back in
not much turn on this one, punched straight to short mid-on
flicked with the spin to midwicket
sensible. Right to the pitch of the ball and he eases it down to long-on
drifting into middle and leg, turned to square leg
quicker one on middle, whipped to midwicket
lunges forward and bunts this to the man coming in from point as they take a quick single
slider on the pads, tickled to short fine leg. Too easy
drifting away from the batsman, Dickwella gets right to the pitch of the ball as he crunches the cover drive towards the longest boundary. No chance for deep point. Lovely timing

what a welcome to the bowling crease. Starts off with a back of length delivery, Mathews gives him the charge and then lets his wrists take over as he plays that whippy slap over wide mid-on. Wow, what timing.
hops back and defends the away-going length ball to the off side
imperious pull. Nearly bisected deep square leg, excellent work by Azhar Ali, the sliding stop
nurdled to the man coming in from deep backward square leg
too full and angling down, looks to flick but gets it off the pad, down to fine leg.
deep into the crease as he punches this away-going length ball between cover and point
shows the full face of the bat as he defends the length ball
length ball angling away, bunts this to mid-off and scampers a run. Had to stretch those tense calf muscles in trying to do so. Seems fine, though
beauty! Movement off the pitch for sure. Late movement that did Dickwella in as he pushed away from the body. Excellent seam presentation
another one that angles in from wide of the crease and straightens. Dickwella plays down the wrong line as the ball whizzes past the outside edge
beaten again! Bangs this one in short, Dickwella looks to make room and ease it behind point but is followed by the bowler, cramped for room and is beaten
works the length ball on middle to midwicket. Top over
eases the away-going length ball to point

first wicket of the tournament for Amir and what a big scalp this is. Skiddy length ball angling across Mathews, who looks to hop back and whip this to midwicket. Was late on the shot as the ball deflected off a thin inside edge onto the stumps
full and angling away from the right-hander, left alone
much fuller on the stumps, defended to the leg side
leans into the drive and crunches it square to Imad Wasim at deep point
another quick length ball on off stump, Dickwella defends to the off side. Looked like he was late on the shot and got it off the top part of the bat
back of length delivery on the stumps from wide of the crease, defended back down the pitch

this is a ripper of a delivery! Dhananjaya's vigil didn't even last as long as it did for him to hop onto the plane after boarding was announced. Angles a length delivery that nips away off the seam. Dhananjaya, who should have been pushing forward, makes the cardinal sin of defending from the crease as the ball kisses the shoulder of the bat and through to Sarfraz. Big moment in the game
lunges forward and keeps out the full delivery to the off side
inside-edge but onto the pad. On the move as he looked to drive that on the up
steers the away-going delivery to point

sensational catch from Sarfraz! He was moving to his left and had to suddenly change direction as Dickwella got a thick inside edge. It flew low to Sarfraz who put his left glove low to his left to pull off a stunner. Hadn't taken a wicket in the tournament coming into today's game, now he has two in two and two big wickets. That of the two set batsmen. Sri Lanka are on a freefall here
full and angling into the pads, late on the flick, deflects off the pad to the onside and they take a legbye
schoolboy error at point. Fakhar Zaman lets one through his legs at point to concede a single. Gunaratne off the mark. Did he get a bad bounce? No. Just didn't get the body behind the ball
feels for a full-length delivery angling in from wide of the crease, beaten. No conviction whatsoever behind the shot

Dropped. looks to cut a full ball but gets a thick edge that flies low to Sarfraz's right. He moves instinctively to collect the catch. All good until then. But as he turned to complete the catch, he lost control and the ball bobbled out of the glove. Things happening. What a spell. He knew it wasn't a clean catch, perhaps and went up immediately. Superb reflexes nevertheless. Had it in his grasp till he lost control once the elbows hit the ground.
full and straight on the stumps, squeezed to the leg side.
right behind the line of that length ball on middle as he blocks
mistimes a punch to wide mid-off. Bat face turned in his hand as he met the ball
surprised by the short ball, takes on the bowler with the pull, top-edges it down to square leg. Didn't carry to the boundary rider.
edged but well stopped by Babar at slip. Just short of him but he stayed low and got up with the bounce
works this full ball wide of mid-on as they scamper a run

they're swinging Sri Lanka out of the competition or what? This is some stunning bowling.  Floats this ahead of length on off, the ball deviates ever-so-slightly as Thisara looks to flay this away from the body, gets a thick edge that is taken superbly in front of his face by Babar at a wide first slip.
gets this to tail one full and back into the right-hander who lunges forward and blocks
driven uppishly to backward point
handy runs. Too quick for the batsman and keeper. Full and slanting this down leg, Gunaratne misses the flick. Sarfraz can't get there either despite a dive to his left
right into the blockhole from wide of the crease, I'm not sure how Lakmal got an under-edge on that
driven wide of cover as they scamper a quick single
chopped to second slip. Once again feeling for the ball with an angled bat
attacks the stumps with a length ball on off, keeps a touch low, Lakmal toe-ends the defensive shot
cross-seam delivery on off stump, hits the top part of the bat as he blocks forward
bunted wide of midwicket for a quick single
nurdles a length ball on middle and leg towards square leg
pulled away into the longest part of the ground, between deep square and deep fine leg
width outside off, slapped to deep point
gets slight movement away, but this length ball is too wide. Hammered on the up to sweeper cover
back of a length, wide outside off. Dabs at this aimlessly, beaten on the outside edge
full at off stump, half a stride across to tap this to mid-on's right
big inswinger, full and aimed for off stump, toe-ended drive to extra cover
swings it in again, but this is a length ball on the pads, nudged into the open square leg region
vicious inswinger again, batsman plants his front foot well across and his head falls over into the off side as he flicks this very very late. Azhar misfields at deep square
close call but going down. Full and flat drifter catches the pads as he looks to flick
flat batted shot, looks to cut against this which slides in, under edge into the off side
length, angled in, punched back to the bowler
repeat, punches an arm ball back to the bowler
fuller this time, angled in at off stump, defended off the front foot
another arm ball, good length, off stump, defended off the front foot. A quick over and a maiden
full and straight outside off, left alone
floated ahead of length outside off, Gunaratne wants to play but decides against it in the end
late reverse back in from outside off, squeezed to mid-on

hesitation but both batsmen complete the run. Lakmal wasn't keen but makes it through in the end. Good work by Imad, anticipating the stroke early and moving to the left as the batsman bunted it there
full-blooded hit but straight to mid-off
yorker length ball but way outside off, looks to squeeze this behind point but is late on the shot
steps out and works the indrifter to wide long-on
skiddy delivery on middle, hit high on the pad as he looks to whip it across the line
struck on the pad but the drift would've taken it down leg. Not much turn, looked to work it with the angle to square leg off the frontfoot
gets to the pitch of the ball and eases it down to long-off

gets outside the line of the stumps to tickle this fine but misses. Oxenford initially signalled wide and immediately changed his mind. Got a signal from the square leg umpire that it flicked the pad on the way. Good umpiring
mistimes a cut straight to point
looks to fetch a pull from outside off but is beaten as he played too early
right in the slot and he's thumped it wide of mid-off, who didn't even need to move. That's more like it
angling into middle and leg, hit on the thigh pad as he looks to work it leg side
shows the full face of the bat to defend one angling in from wide of the crease
eased down the ground to long-on, committed himself fully forward as he met the ball
slight inswing, but this is too full outside off, Lakmal uses his reach to get to the pitch of the ball and loft this back over the bowler's head. Lovely.
forces a length ball straight to cover
makes room and cuts the short ball straight to backward point
punched to long-on. Too much drift this time into the stumps
whips one form outside off to midwicket
looks to slap that away through the off side, mistimes it straight to Babar at cover
sliding into the pads, flicked to deep backward square leg. 200 up for Sri Lanka
handy runs, too straight and on leg stump, Gunaratne tickles this down towards fine leg where Fakhar Zaman throws himself full stretch to save one run
hops back and across to defend the pacy short of length ball on middle
low full toss on the pads, flicked wide of mid-on
whacked back over Amir's head. That's the short  boundary. Important runs. Too full once again from Amir, right into Lakmal's swinging arc. Super timing, good it off the middle of the bat
pulled away from outside off towards deep midwicket
sways out of the way of that short ball outside off, on the bounce to the keeper
hoicked away into the midwicket region, couple of bounces towards the boundary rider
slower bouncer but loses direction. Way down leg.
shapes to play a square drive, gets a thick outside edge to third man

completely deceived by the slower delivery. The offcutter this time at length, Lakmal was through with the hoick even before the ball got to him, missed it completely as a result with the ball kissing the bails. Handy knock nevertheless.
somehow manages to keep that inswinging yorker out. Exposed all three stumps by backing away, the ball followed him but he jammed his bat down in time
eased wide of cover to get off the mark
steers the full delivery straight to point
starts off with a yorker on middle, kept out
length on middle, worked to midwicket as Malinga gets away from strike.
backs away to slash but the bowler follows him by dishing in a short ball on the stumps, left alone
slower bouncer, way over the batsman's head. Asela did well to offer no stroke to that even though there was a temptation to go after that.
sitter dropped by Faheem Ashraf at short third man. Surprised by the pace. Asela plays a reverse paddle to a low full toss outside leg, hit it well but ballooned straight to the fielder.
right behind the line of the length ball on middle
squeezes a yorker-length delivery on middle to mid-off
makes room and bunts the length ball slanting in from wide of the crease
thick edge down to third man. Steep bounce, jabbed at it with an angled bat
makes room and flays this short ball wide of point, Malik comes around to cut that off at square third man
direct hit at the bowler's end and Malinga could've run back to the dressing room. Hafeez the fielder in question at cover. Just bunted it to the off side and went off for the run

what was that? Looked to scoop it over short fine, but the ball was banged in short, he went through with the scoop from the crease and lobbed it over the keeper. Astonishingly, he was looking towards point when the ball deflected off his bat. He was looking away because it was coming straight in towards the helmet
bunts this sensibly into the off side and scampers a quick single
looks to back away and clobber the away-going length ball over long-on but missed. Played too early.
makes room and slashes this over point, third man comes around quickly to keep it to a single
super stop at short fine by Hasan Ali. Saved a certain boundary. Glanced nicely by Malinga, it was a leg-stump half-volley
shaped to cut but Amir followed him with the short ball and hit him on the back of the head as he took his eyes off the ball.
slapped into the gap at deep extra cover. Both feet were off the ground as he met the ball
full on the pads, looks to flick but misses. Just outside leg so wide called
short on middle, pulled all along the ground to deep square leg

hoicked straight to the man at deep midwicket. It was a risky proposition because he had to clear the longer boundary, his task was made tougher by the fact that it was an slow offcutter. Couldn't have picked out the fielder any better.
backs away and slaps the length ball wide of cover for a quick single
pushes outside the line of the delivery, gets a thick inside edge to deep square leg
swung through early, missed it completely. Looked to smack the slower ball over midwicket. He, of all people, should have known it was a slower delivery through the subtle change in action
lobbed off the inner half of the bat towards midwicket. They scamper a quick single
right behind the line of that full-length delivery on middle
tails a full ball into middle and leg, squeezed to the man coming in from deep midwicket

squared up by the length. Looks to work this skiddy short of length delivery from outside off towards midwicket but ends up getting a leading edge back to the bowler. As far as return catches go, it can't get simpler than that.
good length, just outside off stump. The sling-angle takes it away after pitching, Azhar leaves it alone
in the corridor once more, good length, left alone
good length, corridor, punched on the up to mid-off
back of a length in the channel, arches to carve this square on the off side, but there isn't enough room

dropped! Gunathilaka is usually a top class fielder. But he's put down a simple one first up. This was slightly short and there was more room than the last one. Went for the cut, hit it in the air and found the fielder at point who can't hold on
back of a length outside off stump, left alone
length ball, down the leg side without any movement, he watches it go
back of a length at off, slight movement in off the pitch, defended off the back foot

a near run-out chance and this time Gunathilaka cannot pick up the ball for an underarm throw. Azhar Ali was at least four yards out as the fielder ran in from point. Zaman had dropped this into the infield off the front foot
good length, off stump, pushed on the up to extra cover
good length, angled in at middle stump, pushed to square leg on the up
good timing. Tas this length ball on the up from off stump, it flies through to midwicket on the bounce
back of a length at off stump, poked to mid-off on the up
yorker, swerves away and dips like a Ronaldo free kick, Zaman clears the front leg and toe-ends this to mid-off
goes for the slower yorker this time, gives him some width and bowls it too full. Enough time for Zaman to adjust and places this past cover point

this time not in so much control, but that's four anyway. Overpitched at off stump, and his natural angle takes this away from Zaman who goes through with the drive. Off the outside half of the bat and it rolls away rapidly
back of a length outside off stump, left alone
sweeeeeeeeeeet. It's a small stride and all hands from Zaman. This is overpitched and wide. There's an extra fielder in the off side now too, but he's got this through

the comeback! Excellent stuff. Angles a length ball at off stump. It's a ball that requires feet movement, but there isn't any from Zaman who is beaten and then walks into the line as this climbs over off stump
nice. Back of a length, pitches in the channel, jags away and past the outside edge as he feels for this
length, tight line, defended back to the bowler
good shot, no run. ODI Azhar summarized. This is length at off stump, he's on his toes and punches this with great timing. Can't get it past midwicket's dive
good length, off stump, punched on the up, straight back to the bowler...who throws the ball back fiercely
he has a strike rate. Good length, off stump, pushed on the up past the non-striker and nice, loud call as mid-on comes across to his left
poor ball to finish. Short, leg stump, and he just has to swivel and get bat on this. He does both, tickles it fine
good length at middle stump, whipped on the up to midwicket
back of a length outside off stump, sliced on the up to third man
good length, angled in at off stump, defended back down the pitch
back of a length, a bit of width, chopped into the turf on the off side
good length at off stump, pushes it into the off side with soft hands and takes off immediately. There is a pick up and a throw and a direct hit this time. But Azhar is in...doesn't slide his bat
good length at off stump, tucked on the up to mid-on
good length at middle stump, defended off the inside half to midwicket
back of a length at leg stump, another hit-me from Lakmal to Zaman. But this hits the thigh guard as he swivels and so it's only a single
good length at middle stump, flicked to short midwicket
swipes across the line and gets it over the infield. Well over the infield. This is back of a length at off stump, he gets it off the middle and a couple of bounces into the midwicket boundary
good length at off stump, nicely timed straight drive is cut off by the bowler's hanging left palm
shot. Shuffles across, gets all of this flick from middle stump, but square leg is deep
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length outside off stump, dabs it, aerially, down to third man
back of a length, slanted across the left hander who is beaten on the square cut
good length, well wide outside off stump, slashes and misses
good length, angled away from off, kisses the outside edge and runs down to third man
well bowled. This nips in sharply from a length, not too different from the Mendis dismissal. But Azhar is on the front foot and this clips his thigh guard en route to the keeper
back of a length at the hips, turned down to fine leg
whoa, hello. What. A. Shot. Over the sightscreen and out of the stadium. Gives him the charge first up, gets to the pitch of this length ball and gets well under it with a big swing of the bat
leading edge falls in front of short extra. This one if dug in back of a length at off stump, he looks to close the face on it, too early
good length at leg stump, turned into the open midwicket region
get out of the way! Perera thinks about his insurance as he skips out of the way of this. Another length ball met at the pitch and absolutely drilled back down the pitch
goes for the slower yorker at leg stump, it drifts away with the wind, down leg side
another slower ball, good length at middle stump, pushed to short midwicket
back of a length at off stump, open-face tap to short third man's left
outside edge falls short of first slip. This is back of a length and angled across the corridor. He hangs out a bat at this. Edge pings off first slip's shin and runs away to the third man boundary
bouncer, well short, he's not even going to attempt a shot. Dickwella leaps high and holds on with a hand
good length at middle stump, pushed on the up past the bowler, mid-on dives to his right and keeps it to one
again, jags one in ferociously and raps Azhar on the pad. It hits him high and outside the line, down to third man for the fifty partnership
top edge and six! Length ball, wide of off stump. He wants to swing this over the midwicket boundary, he ends up skewing it over third man
overpitched at off stump, pushed to mid-off to steal a single
good length, angled in at middle stump, raps him on the thigh guard as he looks to flick
angles this into the hips, and he uses it nicely to tickle it past short fine
bouncer, too short for the hook, lets it go
back of a length, cramps him at the mid-riff, but he gets a thick inside edge that runs away to fine leg's right
offcutter, back of a length at off stump. Shapes to cut, forced to bunt it to point. Not enough room
preshurrrrrr. Short ball, angled wayyyy down leg side
short and into the pads again, swivel-pull, straight to fine leg
takes an age to land at off stump, good length. Zaman patient. Watches it onto the bat, pushes into the open off side
tossed up at leg stump, flicked to midwicket's right and he gets a hand on it...can't stop though
back of a length at off stump, punched off the back foot to sweeper cover
back of a length at off stump, back foot punch to sweeper cover
nicely placed. Short from Asela, and outside off stump. He usually slaughters these off the front foot, but he's waited this time and opened the face to get it past slip and backward point
good length outside off stump, pokes it into point and brings up his fifty. Well played, well played
good length, slight swing away from middle stump. Forward stride. Off stump is exposed but he's cut out the movement. Defended on the front foot

finds the fielder at fine leg. Takes on the bouncer and is not in control. Takes his eye off the ball at the last moment and top edges this. Pradeep is anxious as this is hanging in the air, then relieved when the fielder hangs on. Is this their way back?
back of a length at off stump, late on the back foot defence, jams it into the crease and just away from his off stump
good length, slight movement in, but the off stump is nicely covered and so is the line of the ball. Solidly defended
good looking shot, straight to point. Rolls his wrists as he drives this on the up outside off, one-bounce to point
shot. Back of a length, wide outside off. Sits up nicely, dispatched through cover point nicely
good start. Hits the deck, back of a length, and straightens it in the corridor. Azhar slightly squared up as he defends
good length at off stump, gets on his toes and shovels this wide of mid-on
good length, pitches on leg, goes further down
back of a length, nips back in from middle, defended into the leg side
back of a length outside off, square drive off the back foot, straight to point
bouncer, doesn't rise. It's short and Babar gets under it before it loops rapidly and lands in front of the keeper
back of a length at middle stump, clipped to midwicket off the back foot
good length, outside off stump, left alone
short ball at off stump, transfers the weight nicely, brings the wrists down perfectly and gets a single for this hook
good length at leg stump, soft-handed whip to square leg

back of a length outside off, slashes hard with the cut, gets an under-edge to third man's left...Dickwella gathers the throw, goes for a cheek underarm throw at the non-strikers and Malinga is not backing up. One becomes three
back of a length at middle stump, on his toes to flick this to fine leg
short and wide, cut hard and aerially, gets it over point and wide of third man
good shot. Another well-controlled hook shot, this one was at his grille. Rolls his wrists, gets it to fine leg
back of a length outside off, slight lift and skid. Past the outside edge. Keeper and bowler think this is very close. It was, but no sound
back of a length at middle stump, hurriedly pulled off his hips, mistimed, but a single to fine leg
gives him the charge, adjusts for the short, wide ball, stabs it out to third man
good length, just outside off stump. Looks to run this down to third man. Slip gets across fast and a loud call of 'no' from Azhar at the non-strikers
full at off stump, toe-ended push to mid-off
bouncer at middle stump, watches this closely with the hook, keeps it along the floor to fine leg
back of a length outside off stump, punched off the back foot to point
good length outside off stump, looks to punch on the up through the covers, bat turns. Mid-off fields
bouncer, too short, too wide down leg

picks out midwicket! Tentative from Babar. This is back of a length, and he has time to whip it. Plays close to his body and doesn't roll the wrists enough. Straight to midwicket, he didn't have to move. Soft dismissal
back of a length outside off stump, gets on top of the bounce and pushes this to third man
another bouncer, another controlled hook. Only one person winning that short ball contest. Single to deep square
and another bouncer. No fuss, swivel, hook, single.
back of a length outside off, nicely timed push on the up, straight to extra cover
back of a length at off stump, defended into the covers off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, back foot defence

we have a game on, folks! Another very, very soft dismissal. Back of a length, into the hips. An easy tickle to fine leg on most days, but Hafeez is also tentative like Babar was. Leading edge balloons to mid-on who makes no mistake
...and then he bowls it full and wide outside off for Malik to lean into and, gloriously, drive to the cover boundary
back of a length at off stump, tapped on the up to mid-on
good shot. There is no discomfort at all with the short ball for Azhar. They insist on it. This is wide outside off stump and he ramps it over and to the right of the keeper
back of a length at off stump, closes the face and glances this to deep square
full at leg stump, nervous poke very late, but he offers the full face and steals a single through mid-on
good length, outside off stump. Leans into the forward push, finds sweeper cover
good length at off stump, defended to point off the front foot
good length outside off, nudged to sweeper cover off the front foot
good length, corridor, defended off the back foot
good length outside off stump, solid forward defence into the off side
short and wide, flambouyant swipe with the cut, gets it to third man
short at off stump, doesn't rise too much, but the pull is controlled again, deep square cleans up
bouncer at off stump, too short, Malik sways out of the line and drops the bat
gets on top of the bouncer, gets a nice high elbow, defends this into the off side
good length at off stump, pushed on the up to mid-off

and this is why Mathews is a captain! Lakmal gets Azhar to fend away from his body. It's a thick edge that's angling away from Mendis at first slip. He's following the line, to his right, but it swerves to his left and he has done very well to hold on to this. He went with two hands, but because of that movement, he just about grabbed onto it with his left. Bowling change works straight away
back of a length outside off stump, goes for the cut, it slides under the bat
back of a length outside off stump, sheepishly poked into the covers
back of a length outside off, punches this into the gap at covers. Or he thinks so, till he sees Gunathilaka slide across the turf to his right and cut this off
back of a length outside off, slices out to third man
bouncer, leg stump, climbs into this hook. Gets it down to fine leg

oooohhhh goes every Sri Lankan. Also all my colleagues. Malik shuffles across early. So early, and barely gets bat down on this yorker that was headed for middle stump. A single through square leg in the end
angles this yorker down leg side and past the flick
glorious shot. Good length outside off stump, leans into this, gets weight behind it and taps this on the up through cover point

mix-up ends well in the end. Good length, tapped into the off side off the front foot. Takes off, then for no reason at all he freezes halfway. Gunatahilaka with a 360 and a shy, can't hit the non-strikers stumps
good length, swerving in at middle stump, shuffle and push to mid-on
living so dangerously. Shuffles across, gets an in-dipper. Yorker again and somehow, he squeezes it out to mid-on
back of a length outside off, run down to third man
back of a length, close to off stump, but he arches back and slices this to third man

direct hit and he might have been gone. Poor running. Pressure getting to the captain. Pokes this length ball to mid-on and the only thing that saves him in the end is a tough, one-stump angle for the fielder
sweetly timed cover drive, races to sweeper cover
full and angled into the pads, easy flick to deep square for a single
good length, angled in at off stump, defended back down the pitch
the perfect yorker. Middle stump. Well respected, tapped to safety
yorker at the toes this time, goes for the flick, thumped on the pad
inswinger, full at middle stump, driven straight to mid-on
another yorker. Swinging in at off stump, jammed out into the off side
good shot. Full inswinger at off stump, driven to mid-off
nearly chips to short midwicket. Bowls him a slower ball, good length at middle stump. Sarfraz closes the face on this instinctively, chips it upwards but it lands safely in front
back of a length at off stump, back foot punch, straight to point
inswinger, good length, headed for off stump. Opens the face and defends this to point
back of a length outside off, chopped down to third man
nicely placed. Watches this inswinger closely, get to the pitch and pushes this neatly through midwicket. No fielder there and deep square has to get across
back of a length outside off stump, left alone
back of a length outside off stump, prods at this away from the body, uppishly towards point
oh he's played that so late. This yorker was headed for leg stump, but he's brought down the axe on this just in time
offcutter, good length, watchfully pushed to third man
the batting gods, they're with Malik at the moment. Shuffling across the line a ridiculously long way, but it's working for him. Turns this yorker off middle stump to fine leg
good length outside off stump, leans into the over drive and gets a single to sweeper cover

feathered to the keeper! Malinga wins the battle. Sees all the shuffling, changes his length and cramps him. It's a short ball at his ribs. He's inside the line and looks to parry this fine with a pull, but he gets in on the glove and Dickwella has moved nicely to his left to hold on
shuffles across with two yards of the run up still left. Gets a full ball down leg side first up
yorker outside off stump, met on the full, pushed to mid-off
full outside off stump, looks to drive, gets it off the inside half down the pitch
back of a length at off stump, pushed off the back foot to sweeper cover
oh beautiful. Full and wide outside off stump, leans in and gets to the pitch, holds the shape and middles this cover drive
edge? Yes! He changes his angle, goes over the wicket and angles this across the left-hander who plays a loose shot. Pokes away from the body, regulation edge, regulation catch, six down.
sweetly timed. Full ball at leg stump, flicks it to mid-on
back of a length outside off stump, left alone
short ball at middle stump, swivel pull out to deep square
good length at middle stump, defended into the leg side
'welcome, my name is Malinga. I bowl slower yorkers.' This one at off stump, makes him play well in front, flicked to short midwicket
and then a bouncer. He goes after it, too late on the hook, flies over his left shoulder
smoked! 'I'm Faheem Ashraf, I hit sixes.' What a shot. Bouncer angled into the ribs, he gets behind quickly and middles this hook to get it sailing over fine leg
short ball at off stump, nicely on top of the bounce before dropping it square for a single to third man
goes after another bouncer, doesn't quite time this, but it's wide of fine leg - to his left. One bounce, four
good length, angled across off stump, pushed into the open point region
back of a length outside off, climbs into it and opens the face to bisect backward point and gully, third man gets work to do
good length, off stump, bat turns in his hands as he drives, gets him a single wide of mid-on
hurries him on the bouncer, too quick. He had shaped to muscle another one, let it go last moment without bothering to bring that bat down
another bouncer. This hits him flush on the elbow as he fends awkwardly. But he won't care. It bobs over the keeper and runs away fine
fired into the stumps from around the stumps, turned to midwicket
touch short, bunted off the backfoot to midwicket
looks to paddle it fine, can't get much bat on it. Keeper is alert to the possibility of them scampering through. Does well to run across quickly to stop that

a direct hit from Gunathilaka from midwicket at the bowler's end and Sarfraz was gone! Tapped it gently and took off for the run immediately. Coach Mickey Arthur grimaces from the dressing room. Phew, what was that? Why would you risk a single like that when the asking rate is less than four?
lunges forward and blocks
drifts one into the stumps from wide of the crease, Ashraf gets a long way forward to smother that
back of a length at middle stump, tapped on the up to mid-on
full outside off stump, loose bottom hand on the cover drive, bat turns. Uppish in the end, but cover is sweeper
back of a length at middle stump, short-arm jab wide of mid-on
good length at off stump, leans into push this to sweeper cover

Oh this looks close! Straight drive, fingertip, then tip of the non-strikers stumps. Faheem plonked the bat in. Third umpire has been called for. This is the matter of half a frame. He's out! Can you believe it! Poor technique from the young man. A lazy plonk after backing up a long way. The replays show a shadow under his bat as the bails light up, so he's out. A pedestrian length ball at off stump, hit off the middle, has ended up as a wicket somehow. Somehow - why is it always somehow with Pakistan?
back of a length at off stump, tapped into the off side on the up
back of a length outside off stump, thumped off the back foot to sweeper cover
tossed up at leg stump, tickled off the front foot to fine leg
full at off stump, driven back to the bowler gingerly
back of a length at middle stump, back foot punch to long-on
tossed up at off stump, looks to push this through the covers, gets it to midwicket off the inside half
flat, good length slider, thumps him on the pad, outside the line of leg stump. That won't stop them from appealing
back of a length outside off, chopped wide of third man and comes back for a tight second
back of a length outside off, slapped on the up, straight to extra cover
short ball at middle, nicely on top of the bounce, keeps the pull down to deep square
good length at off stump, defended into the covers off the front foot
good length at off stump, back foot defence to mid-off
good length at off stump, solidly behind this to defend off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, pushed to extra cover off the back foot
good length, middle stump, flicked straight to midwicket
tossed up outside off stump, plants the front leg across and pushes it back to the bowler
good length, middle stump, driven to long-on
back of a length outside off stump, late cut, finds backward point
looped nicely at middle stump, tapped watchfully to mid-on
oh close! Pins him on the back foot, hits him in front of middle and leg with a length ball. Called not out, Mathews says too high to review
good length, way down the leg side
good length, tailing into the pads, flicked to deep square
full outside off stump, cover drive, straight to extra cover
back of a length outside off stump, slapped on the up past short extra and another really close second run. Sarfraz has run poorly today
back of a length at off stump, defended into the off side off the back foot
good length at off stump, pushed to deep point with an open face, Sri Lanka happy to give away the single
floated in at off stump, flicked to short midwicket
he bowls a medium-pace delivery! What?! Takes everyone by surprise, especially the slip fielder who copped one in the chest off an under-edged cut
back to normal. Floated at off, pushed into the covers
back of a length outside off stump, cut to deep point
back of a length at middle stump, driven to long-on off the back foot
full at leg stump, pushed to mid-on
full at off stump, tentative forward defence
classy shot. Leans into this overpitched ball, places the cover drive to sweeper cover's right
bouncer at middle stump, swivelled pull, in control, single to fine leg

back of a length outside off stump, sliced to point who puts in a sensational dive to his right to keep it one...but Mendis runs in from slip, performs a 360 and gifts four overthrow runs through mid-on
bouncer outside off stump, Sarfraz well under it, and it's called a wide
back of a length outside off, tucked into the leg side off the back foot
good length at middle stump, watchfully defended into the leg side
bouncer at middle stump, gets him ducking hurriedly. Loud boos from Pakistan supporters, they saw a wide there
short ball outside off stump, mistimed cut past backward point, but that's the long end and it's three
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot. Now loud cheers for a dot ball from the Pakistan supporters
shot...fielded! Oh, the margins! This was a well timed straight drive that nearly made it past mid-on. But Lakmal, big quick bowler, puts in a dive to his left and saves three
full at middle stump, defended with the full face, to loud cheers
good length, solidly behind this, defends into the off side
shot...and four first ball! Good timing, good placement. Waits for the short and wide ball to come on, opens the face, hits one wide of third man to tease him and then beat him
back of a length at off stump, chopped straight to point
good length at off stump, defended solidly
back of a length at off stump, pushed towards mid-on, midwicket rushes across
back of a length and wide outside off, chopped to third man, easy peasy

back of a length at middle stump, pokes it into the leg side and takes off. Sarfraz sends him back. That went straight to square leg. Apologies from the fast bowler who has shown great composure so far
goes for the bouncer. Sarfraz not troubled. Happily ducks under that. 1 down, 17 to go
and a bonus run. Misses his line on the slower yorker, it's down leg

dropped! Someone call the contractors, Perera needs a hole at mid-on! Oh no, he won't forget this ever. A nice, floated slower ball, full at middle stump. Sarfraz is outfoxed. Chips this straight - dead straight - into Perera's chest at mid-on. Hard hands from the allrounder. Can't even recover. Unbelievable.
slower yorker, turns into a full toss at his pads, tucked down to fine leg
another slower yorker. Met on the full and squeezed through point
overpitched inswinger at off stump, driven firmly. Malinga gets the left boot out, saves the boundary, prevents the single
slower ball, full at middle stump. Flicked uppishly to mid-on, where Perera has a barrier behind this
back of a length outside off stump, uses the angle to run this down to third man
good length, slight movement away. Sarfraz plays across the line from deep in the crease, just gets bat on this and pushes it into the leg side
offcutter, back of a length, pushed back to the bowler on the up
drops it short at middle stump, a confident pull shot, along the carpet to deep square
bouncer from around the wicket, Amir down so quickly, lets it go
full ball, tailed into the pads. Thuds into the front one as Amir misses the flick. A bit of bat would have got him four

dropped! Again! Sri Lanka are getting half-chances at the moment, and they're getting easy ones, but they're not holding on to any of them. This is slower bouncer. Sarfraz is early on the pull and top edges this to deep square. The fielder runs in some 10 yards and dives forward, bur he can't hold on. Seekugge, subsitute fielder
offcutter at off stump, poked on the up, fumble at extra cover
furious yorker from around the wicket, dug out, he's survived aother

poor cricket. Sri Lanka are letting this slip. Slower ball at length, beats him on the outside edge. Keeper can't gather this on the bounce and it deflects off his leg and runs away to the fine leg boundary
misfield. Dhananjaya at short extra, Slower full toss, tapped straight at him, and he lets this through
slower ball, good length, middle stump. Watchfully defended to loud applause
back of a length, middle stump. Neatly tucked away to deep square with the angle
offcutter, good length, down leg stump. Sarfraz watches it closely, gets bat on it, rolls the wrists - it's four! Fine leg is square
full at middle stump, tickled off the inside half of the bat to fine leg and that's fifty runs for the eighth wicket
back of a length at middle stump, keeps giving him the angle from around the wicket, he keeps milking the square leg region
lovely! He wouldn't be out there on another day, but today he's played his best shot to bring up fifty at a crucial stage. Picks the offcutter, leans into this, drives firmly past mid-off
offcutter, full at middle stump, driven straight to mid-on
good length, middle stump from around the wicket, defended down the pitch
good length at leg stump, pushed to midwicket
good length at off stump, forward push to extra cover's right, single
good length at middle stump, tapped on the bounce to short midwicket
back of a length at off stump, makes room, opens the face and runs this to short third
waits for this full one to land, goes inside-out, gets a single to long-off
good length, floated in at off stump, forward block
legcutter, good length outside off stump, poked to point with an open face

b>why would you run there?! Sarfraz is the luckiest man on earth right now, that's why. Amir just gets an inside edge on this good length ball. Would've been plumb. Midwicket runs in and can't hit the stumps
good length, middle stump, tapped to long-on with the full face
this one skids past the inside edge and hits him on the pad, but he's outside the line
finds the cover boundary! This is thrown up full and wide outside off stump. He gets to the pitch and slams this through covers
overpitched inswinger at the toes, clipped to deep square
bouncer...oh and it's too short, this is a wide
back of a length at off stump, gets on top of the bounce, opens the face to drop this to point's right
slower yorker, met on the full, flicked to deep square's right and back for the second
slower ball, low full toss at knee height, calmly tucked to bisect deep square and fine leg

he's done it! Sarfraz Ahmed has huffed and puffed and pushed and fought - and he hasn't done it perfectly - but he has dragged his team into the semi-final. The slower ball is dropped short and wide outside off stump and he waits for it to come on before ramping it to the third man boundary
